channel.title: Blogs on tact.moe
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on tact.moe

item.title: Spring 2021 Anime Diary
item.description: A second entry? Somehow I’ve found it in me to do this again (though much delayed). I saddled myself with way too many shows again and became so overburdedened I wasn’t able to start quite a few of them until partway through the season, but here you go, my thoughts on some shows that caught my eye.

item.title: Winter 2021 Anime Diary
item.description: Welcome to the first seasonal anime diary. I’ll be making these posts once every season to highlight some of the notable anime that caught my eye in the past season.1 To write something about every show I watch would be quite an undertaking, so let’s just start with stuff that really left an impression on me. Where appropriate, I will endeavor to include content warnings for the shows themselves.

item.title: Apple M1 Macbook Air
item.description: So I’ve had an M1 powered MacBook Air, my first Mac, for close to over a month now. And it’s been a life changing experience.

item.title: Setting Custom Ringtones on iPhone
item.description: If you have an iPhone and want to set a custom ringtone, there are a few ways to accomplish this, none of them however are logical or sane. The method outlined here also works on iPad, iPod Touch or any other iOS device and should apply to anything running iOS 12 through to 14 or later.

item.title: Apple Silicon
item.description: At WWDC 2020, Apple announced the transition of the Mac from Intel processors to to their own “Apple Silicon” processors, the same kind as the ARM based chips that power the iPhone and iPad. They also commited to shipping their first Mac with these chips before the end of 2020 and said that they intend the transition to last two years.

item.title: First Post
item.description: Welcome to a first post that isn’t really about much of anything. This will be a blog where I write about anime, tech and other assorted interests. I’m tact and I intend to post to this blog semi-regularly, or whenever I have something to say I guess.
